member.name: T:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTag
member.summary: Represents an html tag that can have a parent, children, attributes, etc. This is a wrapper around the built in class but with a lot more convenience and builder style patterns.

member.name: P:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTag.Contents
member.summary: Gets the contents. This property is very similar to the property, save for the fact that instead of just a string this is now a collection of elements. This allows for more extensive manipulation and DOM traversal similar to what can be done with jQuery.

member.name: M:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTag.ToggleAttribute(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triggers an attribute on this tag. Common examples include "checked", "selected", "disabled", ...
member.param: The name of the attribute
A value indicating whether this attribute should be set on this tag or not.

member.name: P:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTag.Children
member.summary:
Gets the children in the order that they were added.
WARNING: Text nodes () do not count as children and will not be included in this property. See if you want the text nodes to be included.

member.name: M:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTag.Data(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a data attribute. This method will automatically prepend 'data-' to the attribute name if the attribute name does not start with 'data-'.
member.param: The name of the attribute
The value
A value indicating whether the existing data attribute, if any, should have its value replace by the provided.

member.name: M:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTag.Data(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a data attribute. This method will automatically prepend 'data-' to the attribute name if the attribute name does not start with 'data-'.
member.param: The anonymous data object containing properties that should be set as data attributes
A value indicating whether the existing data attributes, if any, should have their values replaced by the values found in

example.code: // results in <a data-index-url="/index" data-about-url="/about"><a> new HtmlTag('a').Data(new { index_url = "/index", about_url = "/about"}).ToHtml()

member.name: M:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTag.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if this is equivalent to . If any of the attributes or the children are different, this method will return false. It is important to note that the order in which styles and classes appear will not affect the equality in any way. However, the order of the does matter. As a rule of thumb, if one would have the same display presentation and behavior in a browser as another , they are considered equal.

member.name: T:HtmlBuilders.HtmlTagExtensions
member.summary: Contains a whole series of useful methods to manipulate common HTML attributes of an HtmlTag

member.summary: Sets the name property. This is a shorthand for the method with 'name' as the attribute parameter value.
